page.title: 15SKITTLES IN BRIDGWATER
page.content: In Bridgwater all the pubs have skittle alleys. There are about 120 teams in the Bridgwater league. The game is played in an alley, usually about 9m long. Each team has six players and eaqch player rolls three balls at the pins or skittles. There are 9 pins at the end of the alley. If some of them are knocked over they are called "Deadwood" if they stay on the Metal Diamond. One person stays at the end of the alley and puts up the pins when they are knocked over. He is called a "sticker up". My Dad plays for the Knowle Inn team and he plays once or twice a week. He has won so many trophies that it is impossible to move in our house. There are no league games played in the summer.
